intro: Bactris tenera, commonly known as the areca palm, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences near the base of the leaves. Bactris tenera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in landscaping due to its elegant appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
